text: Hi <@U03194SP508>, this beta is currently paused. Do you have a specific use case in mind? Feel free to DM me.
<@U7SL518D6> any ideas

Reporting it is the best way to prevent it happening in the future. Contacting support when you experience it enables the engineers to look at the root cause and resolve it. 

Additionally reporting it enables the team to identify trends in issues and resolve them in ways that may solve for more situations at once.
I just thought there might be a way to prevent cashing via the function or something that nature

Your situation of css html and serverless functions all being outdated for a long period of time is something I've not heard of. Especially with serverless functions, i dont think theres actual caching happening there at all.

Not saying at all that youre not experiencing it. Purely saying thats new to me. I would be checking if you have to deploy your serverless functions first. Some folks in the past participated in a beta that requires deploying after uploading the serverless files.
I even cleasred my page cache and it still didnt provide the updates even a day later
So odd
sorry not page cache.. browser cache
What do you mean deployed. I created the functions directly in the DM.

This only applies if the portal was ever opted into a specific beta in the past. (This beta was opt-in only)

In the Design Manager in your serverless function js file you would see 2 buttons instead of 1.

It would say stage changes and publish.

Publish updates the file AND deploys.

When working by the CLI if your account is in that beta you would upload the file, AND have to run a deploy command in the CLI.

The deploy step needs to happen before your changes go live. The reason for the deploy step is that this beta was so developers could introduce custom packages to use in their functions. So to be able to build with those custom packages we needed a deploy step.
CS just sluffed me off cause its OUT OF SCOPE

Re: caching, there are 2 systems on HubSpot that can produce similar symptoms to what you could describe as caching.

There’s the actual cache, and there’s <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/cdn/prerendering|pre-rendering>.

prerendering is where we render the page before it’s requested by a user and store it at the edge, something can be cacheable and prerenderable, Something can be prerenderable but not fully cacheable.

There’s also some functionality that could look like “cache hasn’t been updated” such as `|shuffle` or `|random` where because we want to prerender your content (making it load lightning fast) the shuffle and random filters don’t execute on every page load but instead at a regular time based interval.
So, I suggest contacting support on this as they’ll be able to identify which system and the engineers can then tweak it to make sure it works how you expect.
please send me the ticket id (shows in the support inbox screen)
I guess she was assuming I was looking for help with my code. She opened a ticket and wants me to update it with as many details and explanations as i can provide.
Ill update it and then send it over.

Sounds good, sorry that there was a disconnect/communication issue on support’s end.

They get folks who basically try to get support to do development or debug their code for them sometimes and because not all support folks have web development knowledge it can be hard for them to differentiate between that kind of request and a technical issue with the product.
Oh i get it. I had to be a little short with her so she would understand what i was asking for.
ticket #11893493
thats for being there… now.. back to work for me!!
fyi she sent me to this page for caching issues: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/cdn>
